intro: Solidago simulans, commonly known as the eastern goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small golden clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces showy yellow flowers in late summer and early autumn, which attract various pollinators. Solidago simulans is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and its role in supporting local wildlife.
